<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_073" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_073_L1" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} José Rafael</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">fifth day of the month of August of the year 1839</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a six-day-old child. I named him <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José Rafael</tei-persname>, natural son of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Guadalupe Vigil</tei-persname>, an Indian servant of the late <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José Vigil</tei-persname>, resident of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">La Santísima Trinidad de Arroyo Seco</tei-placename>. His godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Francisco Tomás [Bentos?]</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Soledad Vigil</tei-persname>, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_076" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_076_L3" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} Juan Manuel</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">seventh day of the month of September of one thousand eight hundred and thirty-nine</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and chrism on an Indian child, seven or eight years old, who was rescued from the Ute tribe. Although it has been one year since he was rescued, he is still not sufficiently instructed, but being ill, and with the little that he has learned, he has effectively explained that he desires to join the religion of Jesus Christ. I verified that he is a servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Charles Beaubien</tei-persname>, resident of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Fernández</tei-placename>. His godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Eugenio [Letendosen?]</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Rufina Vigil</tei-persname>, also from San Fernández. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship. I signed it for the record. [^The name of the baptized child was <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Juan Manuel</tei-persname>]</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_103" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_103_R3" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María Soledad</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">twenty-third day of the month of March of the year one thousand eight hundred and forty</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, in urgent need due to illness, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an adult woman, about twenty years of age, which I did according to the rite of our Holy Mother Church regarding the baptism of adults. Having previously started catechism, she was found moderately instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our holy religion, enough for her to be granted her request to become a Christian, in the condition that she was in. I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Soledad</tei-persname>. She is a descendant of the Navajo tribe and a servant of Señora <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Teodora Romero</tei-persname>, who rescued her. The same Señora María Teodora Romero was her godmother, along with her son, <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Jorge Antonio</tei-persname>, of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Fernando</tei-placename>. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship. I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_120" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_120_L1" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María Gabriela</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">thirteenth day of the month of August of one thousand eight hundred and forty</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly baptized a child, two years old, whom I named <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Gabriela</tei-persname>, rescued from the Paiute nation and servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José Gabriel Gallegos</tei-persname>. Her godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José Nazario Gallegos</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Antonia Gallegos</tei-persname>, residents of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Arroyo Seco</tei-placename>. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship. I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_185" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_185_R2" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} José Miguel</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">third day of the month of November of one thousand eight hundred and forty-one</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, five years old. I gave him the name <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José Miguel</tei-persname>, an Indian rescued from the Ute tribe. He is a servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Juan Antonio Abeyta</tei-persname>, and his godfather was <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Pablo Garduño</tei-persname>, both residents of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe</tei-placename>. I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_194" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_194_L1" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José de la Cruz</tei-persname></tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">second day of the month of February of the year one thousand eight hundred and forty-two</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, received a request from the previous year to become a Christian from an adult male, 30 years old, descendant of the Jicarilla tribe. I had advised him that he should be instructed in the knowledge of the principal mysteries of our holy faith and religion, and in the commandments or precepts that Christians accept as their obligation, and the motives for wanting to become a Christian, warning him that the main purpose was to serve God in this life and afterward, to see Him, and to enjoy in the blessedness that He has for his chosen ones in the hereafter. As of this date, he had completed the corresponding catechisms. I found him to be instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our holy religion, and that he was determined to become a Christian so that God would forgive all of his sins incurred up to the present time. [I found him] to be able to receive the other sacraments, ready to serve him faithfully from here on out in order to achieve eternal glory until the end of his days; that he will no longer believe in things of gentilism, of its errors and idolatries, but only in the true God. Now, by means of baptism, he tries to acknowledge and adore him with greater efficiency. By virtue of the authority that I have been granted by my ecclesiastic superior, I exorcized, placed holy oils, baptized him, and anointed him with chrism, all solemnly, according to the rite for the baptism of adults of our Holy Mother Church. His godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Francisco Esteban Vigil</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Rosalía Gallegos</tei-persname>, residents of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Nuestra Señora de los Dolores</tei-placename>. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_220" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_220_L1" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Catarina</tei-persname></tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">twenty-fourth day of the month of May of one thousand eight hundred and forty-two</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, six years old, a descendant of the Ute tribe from which the citizen <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José Mondragón</tei-persname>, resident of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Francisco del Rancho</tei-placename>, rescued her. Her godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Felipe Nerio Maes</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María del Refugio Pacheco</tei-persname>, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_220_L3" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María de la Luz</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">twenty-sixth day of the month of June of one thousand eight hundred and forty-two</tei-date>: I, priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don José de la Cruz Vigil</tei-persname>, as curate, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a four-year-old child, and I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María de la Luz</tei-persname>. She is a descendant of the Ute tribe, servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Juan Bolem</tei-persname>, who rescued her, resident of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Francisco del Rancho</tei-placename>. The godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Juan Bautista Bolem</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Luisa Archuleta</tei-persname>, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed"><tei-persname data-origname="persName">Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname> {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_220_L4 #FHL_007548733_IMG_220_L4CONT" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María Serafina</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">twenty-sixth day of the month of June of the year one thousand eight hundred and forty-two</tei-date>: I, priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José de la Cruz Vigil</tei-persname>, as curate, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, five years old, and I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Serafina</tei-persname>. She is a descendant of the Ute tribe, servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Juan Bolem</tei-persname>, who rescued her, resident of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Francisco del Rancho</tei-placename>. The godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Buenaventura Lobato</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Dolores Córdoba</tei-persname>, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligations and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">José Vigil {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_220_R1" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} José Santiago</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename>, on the <tei-date data-origname="date">twenty-sixth of the month of June of one thousand eight hundred and forty-two</tei-date>: Having been catechized according to what is prescribed for the baptism of adults, and having obtained competent instruction, I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, according to the special rituals, solemnly exorcized, baptized, placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an adult, about thirteen years of age, a descendant of the Ute tribe. He is a servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Juan Roles</tei-persname>, who rescued him a few years ago. He has been educated in his house in the neighborhood of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Francisco del Rancho</tei-placename>. I found him to be sufficiently instructed in the principles, means, and end of the Christian religion (and very enthusiastic, desirous, and aspiring to be received in her, with the faith and hope of obtaining eternal life). I named him <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José Santiago</tei-persname>. His godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Manuel Antonio Sandoval</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Margarita Martínez</tei-persname>, all residents of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Francisco del Rancho</tei-placename>. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">twenty-sixth day of the month of June of the year one thousand eight hundred and forty-two</tei-date>: I, priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José de la Cruz Vigil</tei-persname>, as curate, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, five years old, and I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Serafina</tei-persname>. 				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} José Santiago</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename>, on the <tei-date data-origname="date">twenty-sixth of the month of June of one thousand eight hundred and forty-two</tei-date>: Having been catechized according to what is prescribed for the baptism of adults, and having obtained competent instruction, I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, according to the special rituals, solemnly exorcized, baptized, placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an adult, about thirteen years of age, a descendant of the Ute tribe. <tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_220" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_220_L1" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Catarina</tei-persname></tei-head>

				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María Serafina</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">twenty-sixth day of the month of June of the year one thousand eight hundred and forty-two</tei-date>: I, priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José de la Cruz Vigil</tei-persname>, as curate, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, five years old, and I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Serafina</tei-persname>. She is a descendant of the Ute tribe, servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Juan Bolem</tei-persname>, who rescued her, resident of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Francisco del Rancho</tei-placename>. The godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Buenaventura Lobato</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Dolores Córdoba</tei-persname>, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligations and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">José Vigil {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_220_R1" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} José Santiago</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename>, on the <tei-date data-origname="date">twenty-sixth of the month of June of one thousand eight hundred and forty-two</tei-date>: Having been catechized according to what is prescribed for the baptism of adults, and having obtained competent instruction, I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, according to the special rituals, solemnly exorcized, baptized, placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an adult, about thirteen years of age, a descendant of the Ute tribe. He is a servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Juan Roles</tei-persname>, who rescued him a few years ago. He has been educated in his house in the neighborhood of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Francisco del Rancho</tei-placename>. I found him to be sufficiently instructed in the principles, means, and end of the Christian religion (and very enthusiastic, desirous, and aspiring to be received in her, with the faith and hope of obtaining eternal life). I named him <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José Santiago</tei-persname>. His godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Manuel Antonio Sandoval</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Margarita Martínez</tei-persname>, all residents of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Francisco del Rancho</tei-placename>. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_232" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_232_R2" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María Florentina</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">sixteenth day of the month of October of one thousand eight hundred and forty-two</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a one-day-old infant. I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Florentina</tei-persname>, natural daughter of an Indian servant of Señora <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Ignacia Jaramillo</tei-persname>, resident of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe</tei-placename>. The godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Francisco Jaramillo</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Romualda de Luna</tei-persname>, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_243" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_243_L2" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} Catarina</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename>, on the <tei-date data-origname="date">eleventh day of the month of January of one thousand eight hundred and forty-two</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, out of extreme necessity, having certified her by virtue of catechisms and assessed her intention and desire of becoming a Christian, solemnly exorcised, baptized, and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an adult, sixteen years old. I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Catarina</tei-persname>. She is an Indian servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Juan Manuel Lucero</tei-persname>, resident of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Francisco de Paula</tei-placename>. He himself was the godparent, along with his wife <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Juana María Martínez</tei-persname>. I advised them of their obligation that, as masters of said servant, and also as godparents, they had to give and take care of her education, to teach her Christian duties, and the spiritual kinship that they contracted. I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_281" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_281_L4" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} José Manuel</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">twelfth day of the month of November of one thousand eight hundred and forty-three</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-placename>, according to the rite of our Holy Mother Church for baptizing adults, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an Indian child, ten years old, who was rescued from the tribe of the north. I named him <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José Manuel</tei-persname>. He is a servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Gabriel Abeyta</tei-persname>, who himself was the godparent, along with his wife, <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María de la Encarnación Romero</tei-persname>, residents of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Francisco del Rancho</tei-placename>. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_284" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_284_R1" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} Juan Francisco</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">tenth day of the month of December of one thousand eight hundred and forty-three</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, one month old. I named him <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Juan Francisco</tei-persname>, descendant of the Ute tribe from which he was rescued. He is a servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Antonio Díaz Armenta</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Isabel Sánchez</tei-persname>. His godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Juan Antonio Madrid</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Manuela Romero</tei-persname>, all residents of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Río Colorado</tei-placename>. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_308" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_308_R3 #FHL_007548733_IMG_309_CONT" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María Antonia</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">fourteenth day of the month of April of one thousand eight hundred and forty-four</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an adult, thirteen years old, of the Navajo tribe. I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Antonia</tei-persname>, servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Miguel Mascareñas</tei-persname>, both residents of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Santa Gertrudis</tei-placename>.</tei-p>
				</tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_308_R3 #FHL_007548733_IMG_309_CONT" type="Baptism" data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_309" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">This baptism was according to the rite of our Holy Mother Church with the catechism and approval already having taken place. The godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Nazario Aguilar</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María de la Cruz Mascareñas</tei-persname>, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed"> Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_333" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_333_L3" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María Josefa</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">twenty-fifth day of the month of August of one thousand eight hundred and forty-four</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, seven years old. She is of the Ute tribe, from whom she was rescued. She is a servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Juan Manuel Lucero</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Doña Juana María Martínez</tei-persname>, the same were her godparents. They are residents of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Francisco de Paula</tei-placename>. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record. Her name is <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Josefa</tei-persname>.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_333_R1" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María Dolores</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">twenty-fifth day of the month of August of one thousand eight hundred and forty-four</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, according to the rite for the baptism of adults of our Holy Mother Church, solemnly baptized, exorcised, placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an adult, twelve years old. I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Dolores</tei-persname>. She is an Indian of the Navajo tribe from which she was rescued. The steps of catechism were carried out and she was found well instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our holy religion. Desiring to be admitted to this practice through the holy sacrament of baptism, she recanted the errors and principles that she had acquired in her gentile sect, being completely willing and with the strongest resolution to live in observance of this Christian religion, which is conferred upon her in baptism. She is a servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José del Espiritu Santo Córdoba</tei-persname>. Her godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José Dolores Durán</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Juana María de Gracia Sánchez</tei-persname>, all residents of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Francisco del Rancho</tei-placename>. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_353" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_353_L1" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} José Matías</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">third day of the month of October of one thousand eight hundred and forty-four</tei-date>: Having carried out the corresponding catechisms until found to be well-instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our holy religion, I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly exorcised, baptized, placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an adult, eight years old, according to the rite of our Holy Mother Church for the baptism of adults. I named him <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José Matías</tei-persname>. He is a servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Fernando Trujillo</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Juana María Trujillo</tei-persname>, residents of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe</tei-placename>. The same were also his godparents. The said adult is a descendant of the Ute tribe from which he was rescued. I advised the said godparents and masters of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_353_L2 #FHL_007548733_IMG_353_L2CONT" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María Antonia</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">third day of the month of October of one thousand eight hundred and forty-four</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, four years old. I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Antonia</tei-persname>. She is Indian, descendant of the Ute tribe from which she was rescued. She is a servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Doña María Rafaela Varela</tei-persname>, resident of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe</tei-placename>. The godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Pablo Valdez</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Magdalena Gallegos</tei-persname>, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_354" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_354_L2 #FHL_007548733_IMG_354_L2CONT" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} Juan Lorenzo</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">fourth day of the month of October of one thousand eight hundred and forty-four</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a six-year-old child of the Ute tribe from which he was rescued. I named him <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Juan Lorenzo</tei-persname>. He is a servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Juan Ignacio Martínez</tei-persname>, both residents of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Francisco del Rancho</tei-placename>. The godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Benito Martínez</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Rosalía Mascareñas</tei-persname>, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_354_R1" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María Soledad</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">fourth day of the month of October of one thousand eight hundred and forty-four</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, five years old. I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Soledad</tei-persname>. She is a descendant of the Ute tribe, servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Juan Ignacio Martínez</tei-persname>, resident of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Francisco del Rancho</tei-placename>. The godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José Rafael Martínez</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Rosa Martínez</tei-persname>, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_354_R2 #FHL_007548733_IMG_355_CONT" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} Juan Francisco</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">fifth day of the month of October of one thousand eight hundred and forty-four</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a foundling child who yesterday morning appeared in the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Sangre de Cristo</tei-placename> next to the house of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Felipe Nerio Maes</tei-persname> who picked him up and sheltered him. There was no sign that he had been baptized. [He was] wrapped and completely bundled in a piece of an old sarape. As he was unable to learn who the mother was, he and his wife, <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María del Refugio Pacheco</tei-persname>, took the child from said</tei-p>
				</tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_376" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_376_R1 #FHL_007548733_IMG_377_CONT" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María Luisa</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">second day of the month of January of the year one thousand eight hundred and forty-four</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname> solemnly baptized, placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an adult, about thirty years old, according to the rite of our Holy Mother Church for the baptism of adults. I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Luisa</tei-persname>. She is an Indian rescued from the Ute tribe whose baptism was preceded by the corresponding catechisms until she was well instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our holy Christian religion. She embraced it affectionately and fervently, and she abjured and renounced any errors of the barbarian gentiles in which she had been instructed. The said Indian is a servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Charles Beaubien</tei-persname> and Señora <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Paula Lobato</tei-persname>, residents of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Fernando</tei-placename>. The godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Feliz [Nontin]</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Luz Trujillo</tei-persname>, residents of the same place. I advised them of</tei-p>
				</tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María Soledad</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">twenty-fourth day of the month of March of one thousand eight hundred and forty-five</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a two-day-old child. I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Soledad</tei-persname>. She is the natural daughter of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Guadalupe Bent</tei-persname>, an Indian servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Charles Bent</tei-persname>, who had been rescued from the nations of the north. The godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Elfego Bent</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Romualda Luna</tei-persname>, residents of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe</tei-placename>. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_470" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_470_R2 #FHL_007548733_IMG_471_R2CONT" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María Soledad</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Jerónimo de Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">fifth day of the month of November of the year one thousand eight hundred and forty-five</tei-date>: Having already carried out the necessary catechisms for the instruction of an adult, and having found her sufficiently instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our religion, as well as determined to be baptized for her own honest motives that should [ILL], I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly exorcised, placed holy oils, baptized, and anointed with sacred chrism an adult, about twenty years old, according to the rite that Our Holy Mother Church prescribes for the baptism of adults. She is a descendant of the Ute tribe from which she was rescued, servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Charles Beaubien</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Doña María Paula Lobato</tei-persname>, residents of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe</tei-placename>. The godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José Antonio López</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María de Luz Beaubien</tei-persname>. I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Soledad</tei-persname>, and I</tei-p>
				</tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_500_L1" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María Margarita</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">first day of the month of March of one thousand eight hundred and forty-six</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname> solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, two years old. I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Margarita</tei-persname>. A descendant of the Navajo tribe from which she was rescued. She is a servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José Dolores Córdoba</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Ramona Martínez</tei-persname>, residents of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Sangre de Cristo</tei-placename>. The godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">José Felipe Nerio Maes</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María del Refugio Pacheco</tei-persname>, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_515" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_515_R2 #FHL_007548733_IMG_516_CONT" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María Rosalía</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">twelfth day of the month of April of the year one thousand eight hundred and forty-six</tei-date>: Having already carried out the corresponding catechisms until I certified her to be instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our holy religion, and having the pious affection of becoming a Christian and observing the precepts, I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly exorcised, placed holy oils, baptized and anointed with sacred chrism an adult, according to the rites of our Holy Church for the baptism of adults. I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Rosalía</tei-persname>. She is a servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Juan de Jesús Mares</tei-persname>, resident of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">San Francisco de Paula</tei-placename>.</tei-p>
				</tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_515_R2 #FHL_007548733_IMG_516_CONT" type="Baptism" data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_516" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">The said adult is a descendant of the Ute tribe, from which she was rescued. The godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Juan de los Reyes Mares</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María de la Luz Trujillo</tei-persname>, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship. She herself understands that she is to observe and keep the doctrine of our holy religion. I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_540" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_540_L1" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} María Rosalía</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">twentieth day of the month of June of one thousand eight hundred and forty-six</tei-date>: I, parish priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname>, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, five years old. I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Rosalía</tei-persname>, descendant of the Navajo tribe from which she was rescued. She is a servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Francisco Salazar</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Manuela Vigil</tei-persname>, residents of the town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">La Santísima Trinidad</tei-placename>. The godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Luciano Salazar</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María de la Concepción Salazar</tei-persname>, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Antonio José Martínez {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
			</tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="translation" id="translation" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-pb facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_541" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
			<tei-div facs="#FHL_007548733_IMG_541_L1" type="Baptism" data-origname="div">
				<tei-head data-origname="head">{left margin} Juana María</tei-head>
				<tei-p data-origname="p">In this parish of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Taos</tei-placename> on the <tei-date data-origname="date">twenty-first day of the month of June of one thousand eight-hundred and forty-six</tei-date>: Having already carried out the corresponding catechisms until I certified her to be instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our holy religion, and having the pious affection of becoming a Christian and observing the precepts, I, priest <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Eulogio Valdez</tei-persname>, with permission from the parish priest, solemnly exorcised, placed holy oils, baptized and anointed [her] with sacred chrism according to the rites of our Holy Church for the baptism of adults. I named her <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Juana María</tei-persname>, a servant of <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Doña María Rafaela Varela</tei-persname>, resident of this town of <tei-placename data-origname="placeName">Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe</tei-placename>. The said adult is a descendant of the Ute tribe from which she was rescued. The godparents were <tei-persname data-origname="persName">Don Juan de Jesús Valdez</tei-persname> and <tei-persname data-origname="persName">María Juliana Trujillo</tei-persname>, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligations and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.</tei-p>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed">Eulogio Valdez {rubric}</tei-signed>
				<tei-signed data-origname="signed"><tei-persname data-origname="persName">Antonio José Martínez</tei-persname> {rubric}</tei-signed>
			</tei-div>
		</tei-body>
	</tei-text>
